basics.name: Urian Chang
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software Engineer with a background in software QA testing. Experienced in web development with modern front-end and back-end technologies, SQL and NoSQL database query languages, and RESTful APIs. Experienced in iOS app development with Xcode 8 and Swift 3. Always eager to take on new challenges with a collaborative team and build robust, innovative products.

work.summary: Responsible for evaluating compatibility, functionality, and usability of InFocus collaboration software. Consistently recognized as the top performing tester in the software QA department (15 people).
highlights: Started as Software QA Engineer. Promoted to Senior Software QA Engineer.
Author and execute test plans for InFocus software on desktop and mobile platforms, including Windows, iOS, and Android.
Took over creating custom system images for Windows 7, 8.1, and 10 for production deployment. Write batch scripts for customizations and deployment.
Wrote a Python script to manage the companyâ€™s AWS instances, and automated scripts for testing on Windows 10.

work.summary: Responsible for executing device testing/certification tasks, tracking and resolving project issues in a timely manner and managing project deliverables and deadlines.
highlights: Started as Software & Hardware Test Intern. Promoted to Lead Intern, Product Analyst, and Device Test Lead.
Successfully reached Technical Approval for new products with Open Mobile and T-Mobile GoSmart.
Created guides for device launch timelines and requirements for future product planning and management.
Organized and created After Action Review and Lessons Learned PowerPoint presentations for internal and external reviews at the end of the T-Mobile GoSmart project.

projects.name: LearnKanjiSkip
projects.description: Collaborated in a team of three developers to create a website for teaching how to use the system of kanji indexing by patterns (SKIP). User progresses through levels to practice and become familiar with kanji SKIP codes. I also created a Python script to parse through a kanji dictionary (XML) and generate a JSON file to seed the database.

projects.name: Let's Fly Away
projects.description: Solely created an iOS game where the player can fly around as a dirigible or kite to collect lost balloons and high-five other air travelers. App was created for the SpriteKit hackathon at Coding Dojo from March 10 - 13, 2017. Had to learn and implement SpriteKit and Core Motion frameworks in three days.

projects.name: ChorusLine
projects.description: Collaborated in a team of three developers to create a lightweight music composition iOS app to help users quickly compose a melody when inspiration strikes. The user can choose from two different instrument sounds and hear the melody played back.

projects.name: RunBud
projects.description: Collaborated in a team of three developers to create an iOS app to help runners connect and share their running routes. App was created for the MapKit hackathon at Coding Dojo from March 16 - 17, 2017. Had to learn and implement the MapKit framework within 24 hours.

projects.name: JavaScript Code Editor
projects.description: Solely created a JavaScript code editor built with the Electron framework and Monaco editor. Core features of the app: open .JS files; save code as any file type; auto-complete and text coloring as supported by the Monaco editor.
